medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was found outdoors during early autumn, unresponsive with a Glasgow Coma Scale (GCS) score of 4. He exhibited intermittent somnolence and periods of increasing agitation after admission. Initially, he was unable to follow commands or speak, but could move his arms and legs in response to painful stimuli.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of drug use (cocaine, opiates, benzodiazepines), anxiety, depression with multiple suicide attempts, hepatitis C virus infection, and possible chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).
medical_history.social_history: Smoked cigarettes; previously homeless and incarcerated; divorced with adult children; current living circumstances not known.
